google_reviews.author: Carolyn Puppikerz
google_reviews.review:
I LIST BOTH POSITIVES AND NEGATIVES BELOW:
I love this place HOWEVER it has some issues that all come down to staff. The staff is incredibly under trained and when you ask to talk to their boss they are always in a meeting. We had someone who wanted to become our roomate from another unit and stateside staff left us STRANDED. They offered zero help in any way, and while I understand that theres some stuff we had to do ourselves, they refused to help us get help with things that were very important. Weve asked for maintenance before, and it takes forever. They also dig through the recycling so that if you dont bring cardboard to the basement they will read your address off packages and fine you. This doesnt bother me as much but it really bothers my roommates. THAT BEING SAID, I love the building with all my heart view is beautiful. The units are clean and nice. The free coffee bar is awesome and the events are thoughtful (even though they are underwhelming when it comes to food sometimes). I wish they allowed reptiles but I love that its pet friendly, it really makes it feel like a community. Despite the problems I have experienced I signed in for another year because of the building and the people, and chose to try to tough it out when it comes to some of the folks running it. Also theres this INCREDIBLY annoying squeaky fan in the lobby that makes me crave a lobotomy no idea why that hasnt been fixed but it constantly sounds like a bunch of dying birds and makes me not want to hang out in the lobbys which sucks because I LOVE THE SWINGS!!! Overall its a new place, its got some kinks, but at the end of the day I personally find it worth it for what you get to live in, and while VERY expensive (which I think should be less until their service improves but thats wishful thinking) the units are great and I have really mostly enjoyed living here. Hope it improves where I havent totally loved it yet!

ownerResponse.text: We appreciate your feedback, Carolyn. We apologize for any inconvenience you experienced with our staff and their availability. We'll work on improving our response time and training to better assist our residents. We're glad to hear that you love the building, the units, and the community feel. We'll also take note of your comments regarding the events and lobby fan. Thank you for choosing to stay with us for another year. We'll strive to make your experience even better and will raise your comments about our team to the regional managers involved.

google_reviews.author: Manpreet Singh
google_reviews.review:
Really nice luxury apartments which I have never seen for students before. I stayed here in Summer as a sublet and really enjoyed the location. Good gym and internet amenities.

Just an fyi, dont bother paying premium for Bay facing side, as 1) you dont get much of a view, 2) theres a train that runs pretty much every hour or so and its super load (really LOUD) with its horn blowing the entire time it is crossing downtown (even at 3 AM!), if you are a light sleeper you will not like it.

An oddity I found in this building was there was no AC in the rooms, theres AC in the hallways and common areas. During summer the rooms really heats up, I remember seeing ~ 88 degrees in the room. So definitely have a fan or may be a portable AC.

Also, they for some reason charged me a cleaning fee for washroom while I left washroom in nice condition. I had only stayed there for 2 months and I even cleaned up some mess left over by previous people. I didnt bother disputing the charges with them, I might give them a call.

ownerResponse.text: We appreciate your feedback about the property in the time that you'd spent with us, Manpreet. We're happy to go over any aspects of the community's location and what we're adjacent to if folks have questions following your review! Washington has a fairly standard "no AC" in apartment buildings, but we do apologize if that was a surprise to you and not previously discussed. If there are any lingering questions you have about any of the move-out charges you incur when taking on a sublet, we're here for you! Thanks so much for the review and your time, Manpreet.

google_reviews.author: Finch Guzman
google_reviews.review: I cant believe this place has such good reviews. The entire time I lived at Stateside the management was very poorly run and response times were incredibly slow. I was also charged $160 in damages that I did not cause and that Stateside management knows I did not cause. The previous tenant even admitted to causing them and they still charged me for it and were quite rude during communications about it as well. Everyone that I spoke with was clearly undertrained and usually quite vague and unhelpful, ultimately always directing me to write emails where issues were still not resolved. I would look elsewhere if you are a college student looking for housing outside of dorms. Its not worth the trouble of dealing with Statesides management and all the random fees theyll charge you on top of rent!

ownerResponse.text: Finch - we appreciate you summarizing your experience of living with Stateside in the time you had, as well as prompting action from our team to revisit your circumstance in full to better reply to your review. As a sub-letter, you'd accepted a unit in "as-is condition" which is nominal of foregoing any sort of damage repair, deep cleaning or administrative work that would typically go into readying a unit for a new tenant. What the previous tenant had claimed damage-wise in our outreach to them did not fully encompass the damage present in the unit, leaving those charges to you along with the FMO statement and inspection report with documentation. We'd hate for any of this situation to appear vague or unclear, so if you'd like to visit this conversation with our managers, Genevieve or Lindsay would be happy to discuss over the phone or in-office this week. Thank you again for your review and consideration.

google_reviews.author: Ariel Reyes
google_reviews.review: This place is honestly one of the nicest places Ive stayed, the staff is super friendly and very informative.  The rent is affordable,The furniture and appliances are nice and modern and the community get togethers they hold are super cool. Such as free spritzer day, free plant day etc. The community areas are always clean and luckily the laundry is free so it helped me cut out extra costs. Im surprised any one can find any problem about this place compared to some places Ive rented previously its honestly nicer than some hotels Ive stayed in too lmao.

ownerResponse.text: We truly appreciate every sentence you've written here, Ariel. Thank you for listing out all of the things that have really made your Stateside experience perfect. :) Here if you ever need us!

google_reviews.author: Draegon Moss
google_reviews.review:
Great if you have mommys/daddys money. The rent is pretty steep, they charge an outrageous amount for parking in the garage, currently going for $350 each month on top of rent. Street parking is awful and there are times I have to drive around for 30-45 minutes just to find a legal parking spot that isnt over 3 blocks away. Plus my car has been keyed twice. So if having a car is a must, Id recommend going elsewhere.

As for the apartment itself, its nice, but to get a view of another window and pay $1445 a month for 2 people and a dog in a STUDIO, I think thats a bit much.

They had amenities listed on their website for over a week after moving in, like providing detergent for washing clothes, that wasnt true. They close the sky lounge at 10, which is rather annoying. They lack cleaning staff and the hallways get filthy, floors sticky, trash left in common areas for days, etc.

There are homeless people in the ally who, for the most part are peaceful, but the occasional crazy comes by. Theyve left used needles and baggies laying around. Graffiti on the walls that gets left or poorly covered. The flower beds get crazy over grown and left with trash in them. Not a deal breaker but wheres all the money going?? If things get broken like doors or the intercom system, they stay broken for days, in fact the intercom is still MIA and its been over a month.

Upper management is pretty decent, I dont have any complaints about them, lovely people, but some of the lower staff lets just say theyre annoying college kids and when you have questions they either say yeah we dont do/have that or idk so they should definitely do some more vetting/training.

Internet can be dodgy at times, and all the little activities they plan, which make this place seem fun, happen at very inconvenient times for people who have jobs. No one has time at 1:00-2:00 pm on a Tuesday to do anything fun while working a job and going to school.

Last thing, trying to get any insight on what unit Id be in, how big it was, or even what it looked like was impossible. I had no idea until move in day, regardless of how many times I called. So dont expect to know what youre getting into.

Overall, Im not pleased, especially for how much I pay and how little I get back. If youre a rich kid who doesnt have to worry about costs and working a job, good for you, welcome home. For everyone else, Id recommend elsewhere.

ownerResponse.text: Draegon, thank you for taking the time to thoroughly review Stateside and your time with us. We apologize for the negative experiences you have had during your time here, particularly with the parking and cleanliness. We take all feedback seriously and will take steps to address these issues. Additionally, we will work on improving our customer service and communication with prospective tenants. Thank you for bringing these issues to our attention. If you would like to discuss any further concerns or go deeper into anything mentioned here, please do not hesitate to reach out to us at (360) 762-3972.

google_reviews.author: L L
google_reviews.review:
Really disappointed with this place!!! How are you going to tell your residents to leave up their LED lights because your maintenance crew will take them down safely but still charge for the damage that your maintenance crew caused? We have personally removed lots of lights without causing damage!!!
Also the maintenance crew came into my daughters private room before her lease was up without her permission!! Her furniture was moved and the LED lights ripped down, at that point she still had at least 5 days left on her lease. How scary is that? Knowing that State Side allows their employees to enter apartments without permission?!?! Parents protect your college students!!!

ownerResponse.text: Hi, Laura. We apologize about your daughters experience concerning the lights, and invite you to please contact us if you have any further questions. Wed be happy to explain our maintenance process at Stateside in more detail.

google_reviews.author: Shayn Sath
google_reviews.review: When I first heard about stateside I knew the name had a meaning behind it. A beautiful big 2 building structure with AMAZING views of the bay and the city. Had the opportunity to take a tour in January and walking into the very first unit I fell in love immediately. I signed a lease right after that and I have no regrets. Stateside offers many amenities that other apartments do not. I was amazed at what that offered and how I can know for sure Stateside will be my next home. As far that, Management has been outstanding and always checks up on their residents and their peers among the staff team. By far the best management I have seen by any apartment that are willing to strive for excellence as well as residential needs. If you're looking for your next home. I would highly recommend Stateside as your new home!

google_reviews.author: Teagan Jones
google_reviews.review: If I could put 0 stars, I would. Stateside is filthy, outrageously priced, and holds the most unprofessional leasing staff I have ever dealt with. Don't let the two year old photos fool you- the common areas in this place are filthy. Not once in my two years of living here was a main hallway or staircase vacuumed. On top of the filth, this establishment is  will suck every last penny from their residents. Rent is hundreds higher than comparative apartments, and staff will use every excuse to charge you for pre-existing damages/maintenance. I genuinely could not pick out one good part of my living experience here, except the day I got to move out.

ownerResponse.text: Teagan - thank you for providing your feedback and detailing where you feel Stateside's operations and maintenance could improve. We understand that we're currently in the midst of another conversation regarding your move-out so we will continue to update that thread moving forward. If you'd like to discuss anything mentioned here or otherwise, please do let us know there and Genevieve or Lindsay will be happy to assist you. Thank you so much.

google_reviews.author: Kashmere Carr
google_reviews.review: Super excited to move in next month!! Everyone is so sweet and helpful, especially the leasing manager Lindsay Fulford. I did a virtual tour of the building with her, and just WOW. Ive lived in my fair share of homes and apartments, and this one is just about the prettiest. The attention to detail is incredible, they really understand their target audience (students). Soft-close cabinets to keep noise to a minimum when youre doing some late night snacking, fully furnished, and plenty of outlets. Cant wait to move in!!

google_reviews.author: Jared Dirks
google_reviews.review:
I can only speak to my experience at Stateside, but from what I have heard from others who I met while living there I can say there is generally some things I can comment on confidently.

First and foremost, over the year I lived there Stateside regularly restricted access to some of the amenities as a result of immature behavior from some of the buildings residents. Instead of punishing the people responsible, they restricted access to an amenity (that we all pay for in our lease) and offered no options besides telling us "too bad". Despite the outrageously expensive rent, things like washing machines remained broken/unrepaired for 6+ months. The idea that they would increase the rent, while also opting to charge for laundry moving forward contributed to my decision not to live there again.

Now that my lease is up, they hit me with a 200$ charge for things like "painting" and "waste removal", and even charged me for a key that I returned to the front desk, despite being told by one of their employees it would be taken care of. Move out expenses are typical, but the fact that they charged each one of my roommates $100 for our individual rooms indicates to me that Stateside is just as bad as companies like Hammer and Landmark, fleecing college students and their parents for whatever dollar they can get. I called the leasing office to discuss the charges, only to be ignored and never get a call back.

If Stateside is going to charge me these vague expenses, the least they could do is give me a call back. Their current approach is "pay it or we'll send it to collections".

For students: Stateside is an upscaled private dorm that isn't close to the "experience" they like to market themselves as. If you are paying your own rent (not your parents) this place is way too expensive for what you are getting.

For parents: This place markets itself as an ideal place for students to live and meet people, but will nickel and dime you at whatever opportunity they can. There are better options, and the neighborhood is also extremely unsafe. Car break in's are common, and there has been multiple shootings (yes, shootings) only 2 blocks away on State st. Buyer beware.

ownerResponse.text: Jared - thank you for organizing your thoughts and experience in a review for us and others to evaluate. We want to apologize for the frustrating elements surrounding your experience, namely the closing of amenities while assessing the situations created and the laundry machines being repaired. We are fully functional in both of these areas as of now, and laundry is free as of this lease term. Any questions about move-out charges can be directed to manager@statesidebellingham.com, as we do not dodge conversations about them, we are only able to address complaints in writing and we apologize if that wasn't clear. If there are any questions related to the lease agreement or payment structure, as well as safety/security protocol on site, we are more than happy to discuss them in-office or over the phone. Again, thank you for your full perspective Jared.

google_reviews.author: Kristofferson Family
google_reviews.review: From a parent's perspective so far so good.  Everything we have needed to do with Kasee and Lindsay as been so smooth.  Quick response to ALL of my many questions and very professional.  I hope this is an indicator of how our son's experience living there will be because so far everything is stellar.  He really is excited about moving with all the amenities, close access to downtown and campus and making friends.  I feel confident that he is set up for a great experience.  Thank you for the peace of mind!

google_reviews.author: Lindsay Fulford
google_reviews.review: It can be difficult to find student housing that checks off all the boxes like Stateside does. You are right where you need to be with all the popular shops and restaurants, WWU, and the South Bay Trail only minutes away on foot. As part of the team at Stateside, I am so thrilled to help facilitate the amazing experiences that our residents are going to have this fall. Stateside has such an amazing team working together to support our residents from thoughtful roommate matching to interactive resident events. I can't wait to meet everyone this September for our grand opening! See you soon :)

google_reviews.author: Mason Woolbright
google_reviews.review: If you have a car DO NOT MOVER HERE you will spend 30 minutes or MORE looking for a parking spot. If you dont want to pay the $400 a month for gated parking. The people who work here are rellly nice tho

ownerResponse.text: Mason - thank you for your review and perspective. We're sorry to hear that you've had a negative experience with parking at Stateside. We understand that parking can be challenging in urban areas, and that's birthed the offer of gated parking for our residents after concerns like this one. We would be happy to discuss this option with you further if you are interested - please feel free to reach out to us at your convenience.

google_reviews.author: ellie
google_reviews.review: absolutely love the environment and the people! such a great place to live. everyone is loving and accepting and the staff does everything they can to help at any point!

ownerResponse.text: We really appreciate this day-making insight, Ellie - thank you for your joy and positivity! We will always do what we can for our community. :)

google_reviews.author: Shelby Felthoven
google_reviews.review: I recently signed my lease with stateside and I am ecstatic to move in. Everyone at stateside has been extremely helpful and made the process fast and easy. The apartments are beautiful with great views and a great staff and I cant wait to move in when they open up!

google_reviews.author: Ruby Donaldson
google_reviews.review: I toured stateside and it was amazing. I have already signed my lease but I wanted to see the buildings in person, everyone was so helpful and answered all my questions! They have free laundry and a community kitchen that is so spacious. I can't wait to move in.

google_reviews.author: Emerson Sullivan
google_reviews.review: Lindsay was very helpful and friendly working with her and the building looks beautiful! The fact that there is a bagel shop and fitness center on site is a huge plus. By far the greatest deal I could find in Bellingham for the  amenities and building.

google_reviews.author: Carly Spradlin
google_reviews.review:
Hey there! I'm a CA at Stateside Bellingham, started here a couple of months ago.

What really impresses me about this property is the diversity that is offered. There are many floorplans to choose from on 6 floors with multiple choices of amazing views, (city, bay, mountains, etc.) . There is definitely something for everyone. Also, the owners of this property have made it extremely student friendly. If you are in need of housing in Bellingham definitely check out Stateside!

google_reviews.author: Taylor
google_reviews.review: Great apartment! Love it so much, but the rent and parking is increasing to an unrealistic amount. My roomates and I cant afford the new prices.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the great and honest feedback, Taylor. Always happy to facilitate any discussion related to pricing and leasing if you'd like to chat about it this week or after the holidays! Thanks again for your review.

google_reviews.author: Lillie Adamson
google_reviews.review: I love stateside! Everyone is so friendly and the rent is reasonable. Some of the apartments have funny layouts, but they are all furnished and pretty high quality.

google_reviews.author: Sophia Collins
google_reviews.review: Stateside is a brand new & absolutely beautiful student housing community in Bellingham. If youre on the housing hunt, give us a call- we are here to help make this process super fun and easy for yall!

google_reviews.author: Kasee Castro
google_reviews.review: Ownership and management come from experienced backgrounds and exceptional customer service. Excited to see this community come to the Bellingham market for students looking to elevate their housing experience!

google_reviews.author: Charlie Schmid
google_reviews.review: So clean and crazy modern. Best student housing for Western HANDS DOWN. 2 minute drive and 12 minute walk to campus.

google_reviews.author: Dennis Alexandrow
google_reviews.review: I love it here at stateside! The building is beautiful inside and out and the perfect distance from campus, making it very convenient for students!

google_reviews.author: anna manry
google_reviews.review: they left all the elevators down for hours, i am on crutches and could not leave my house. thank you stateside

ownerResponse.text: Anna - thank you for leaving us a review regarding this instance. A member of our team is reaching out today to discuss this further, as we'd love for you to know the available resources in the event this ever occurs again. The elevators in that building went down unexpectedly last night - but our elevator technician got them back up and running this morning which was the earliest we could get someone to fix it. Again, we're very sorry this left you in a situation and didn't have access to assistance. We hope to have the situation resolved completely, but will talk through this further today. Thanks again!

google_reviews.author: Gabriel Grant
google_reviews.review: There has been a lot of care and attention put into creating a great environment for residents, both in terms of great spaces and amenities as well as excellent management.

google_reviews.author: Nathan Shamseldin
google_reviews.review: This place looks absolutely amazing! From the views to the culture Id give it a solid 10/10. Shout out to Sophia for the awesome tour!

google_reviews.author: eduardo castro
google_reviews.review: Just moved in, loving my new apartment awesome views ;) and great location.. Staff made moving in a breeze. I think I made the right choice!

google_reviews.author: Karla Hernandez
google_reviews.review: The Stateside team was extremely helpful when I was applying. The units look gorgeous and I cant wait to move in!

google_reviews.author: Irena Kolbert
google_reviews.review: Very beautiful rooms and great location. The views are nice, and its super close to WWU.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for this beautiful sentiment Irena. We are so glad you're enjoying Stateside for its location and views!

google_reviews.author: Ava Martin
google_reviews.review: Stateside Apartments make me feel right at home! I love the amenities and I love how close it is to down town.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the love and great review, Ava!

google_reviews.author: Mackenzie Mast
google_reviews.review: Our team is super excited to bring great new student-focused apartments and retail to Bellingham!

google_reviews.author: P D S
google_reviews.review: I am being charged continuously for electricity even when I am not living there anymore.

ownerResponse.text: Hey there - we're sorry that you're experiencing some trouble with the financial aspect of things. We're fairly certain the charges you're seeing are from the last two months, but in the event they're not, give us a call at (360) 946-0820 and we can sort it out together. Thanks for reaching out!

google_reviews.author: Cooper Bronson
google_reviews.review: Been living here for a bit now and the staff are great, super helpful and always friendly!

google_reviews.author: Fernando Gonzalez
google_reviews.review: Great Future student and local housing, great view of the Bay Area!

google_reviews.author: Daniel Ivanov
google_reviews.review: Fixed issues I had quickly and without hassle.

google_reviews.author: Jillian Marie
google_reviews.review: would rate lower if i could.

ownerResponse.text: Jillian, we are so sorry for the frustrations you've encountered with getting your rent paid. We understand that you spoke with our GM Laura yesterday about this situation and the late fee reversal, and we will update you at any point if the check doesn't clear this time around. Again, we do not wish this situation upon any resident and hope that this will be the last time we have to deal with this together.
Thanks for the all-star love, Stephan! Happy to see you having an amazing Stateside experience.
So thankful for your incredible rating, Cassie - let us know if you need anything!
Thank you so much for your great rating, Jesse - please let your Stateside crew know if you need anything else from us. :)

Emilia - once again we would like to apologize for the after-hours situation and hope that we can avoid any discrepancies moving forward. Referencing Lindsay's email from yesterday, if you need to stop by for anything related to your keys, lock or otherwise let us know today. Thank you.
Thank you for the all star rating, Genevieve! Anything we can do to continue this sentiment for you, just let our team know. :)
A beautiful picture to accompany a beautiful rating... made our day, Gavin. Thank you so much!
Thank you so much for the great rating, Abby! Let our team know if there's anything we can do for you. :)
